description:
Honestly, everything was good and fairly priced. We had the pleasure of ordering pupusas; dos de frijol y queso, una vegetariano y una de carne asada. These were the best pupusas I have ever had, it had a great mix of sweet and salty with the cheese and salsa. The cabbage slaw and pickled chile's and carrots that came with the pupusas was out of this world and paired perfectly with the food. 

We also ordered a tamale, and it was good. However, we were not accustomed to Salvadoran style tamales. It was extremely moist but very good! 

Check this place out!
author: Jesse C.

description:
If you like cheese, you're going to love these pupusas!

I have been meaning to stop by here one day because I went to the a spot that served pupusas randomly many years ago with some friends and thought it was yummy!  I absolutely love the decorations here.  There are little soccer balls hanging by the window and soccer scarves all over the walls.  There were some parties gathered by the entrance when I arrived but I wasn't sure where and if there was a sign-in sheet.  I couldn't really get the servers' attention for a bit, but eventually I was seated and it didn't take too long.

I ordered the Carne Asada y Queso (steak & cheese) pupusa, Camaron y Queso (shrimp & cheese) pupusa, and the Loroco y Queso (Salvadorean veggies & cheese) pupusa.  My favorite has to be the steak & cheese pupusa because it had the most flavor.  It was so warm and gooey with cheese!  The shrimp was kind of hidden by the cheese, but it was good.  The Salvadorean veggies were a new taste for me.  What I liked was that the pupusas were not very oily, with the exception of the shrimp pupusa, which oozed out with oil.  There was a burnt piece but it wasn't a big loss.

The food took probably about 15 minutes and they gave some pickled vegetables for the wait and as a side dish.  I enjoyed the pickled vegetables.  They also provided a dish of salsa to go with the food.  Service was friendly.

Each of these pupusas were $3.50 each.  I ordered 3 and was so full, but it was delicious.  If I'm craving pupusas, I'd probably come back here.
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
I love pupusas. 

I love cheese. 

Pupusas are pillows of melty cheese you can hold in your hand and shove in your face. 

If you're a savage like me I suppose. 

The cabbage is delicious and the pupusas are lovely. 

I liked the cheese pupusas and the Lorocco and cheese pupusas the most. 

The other ones are ok. 

There are  more options here than anywhere else I've been - beyond beans and Chicharron, they have beef, chicken, and shrimp pupusas. 

Cheese, I love it. 

Pupusas I love even more. 

This place? Yes. 

Just don't get the tamales. There's barely any protein in them! 

K that's all.
author: Jennifer C P.

description: Been coming here for years. Service is always great food is ALWAYS fresh. From breakfast to dinner, this place is hands down the BEST Salvadoran food in the San Francisco Bay Area! No restaurant can compare.
author: Amanda T.

description: All I have to say is the papusa's  rock here and everything else  for that matter!! Always very clean and the service is impeccable ! Have had almost everything on the menu and have not had a bad meal yet. This is a place you need to visit post-haste!!!  The owner Jackie is such a sweet heart and always hands on!! So glad we were  turned on to this wonderful restaurant ,will be back Sunday!! Say hello to  Lis ,Saundra , Milton, Amara and the rest of the fun crew there!!
author: Curtis L.

description:
We are vegetarian and eat the spinach and cheese, bean and cheese and the super veggie papusa. All are excellent. Service is fantastic. So much better than some upscale restaurants we have been to and left disappointed. 
Highly recommend this place.
author: Su S.

description: The best pupusa place but it is probably impossible to make pupusas bad. They have good horchatas and you can watch soccer there. My mom thinks they are good but she finds it too filling. My dad orders from eat 24 and loves watching soccer while watching the cooks make the food by hand. We had this for my birthday party last year.
author: Noe K.

description:
Mediocre.....the food was really good, we all had pupusas. But maaaaan are they pricey!!! These are probably the most expensive pupusas I've had, honestly. 

The place is small, but clean which makes the experience not bad. The horchata is also very expensive. Maybe I'm just used to more mom and pop places? Either way, they are above your average authentic Salvadorian restaurant pricing. 

I'm pretty sure I won't come back, but if you don't mind paying extra then this is a good spot. Glad I tried it. Sorry I'm being so cheap, LOL but I'm more worried about quality and it wasn't as great as it could've been for the price they charge.


ALSO very stingy with the cortido and tomato salsa that comes to the table for the pupusas, like hello we're four people sharing one tiny sample bowl?? And then it was an issue when you ask for more, they gave us actual attitude. Another reason I don't care to come back, I eat my sides!!
author: Leslie H.

description: good food overall, its better to order take out as they have limited seating. service is ok overall.
author: Christina M.

description: Quite possibly the best pupusas Ive ever had, as far as the plate portions they are smaller than what Im used to for a Salvadorian restaurant, but the food tastes really good so I look past that. Try the pupusas you wont be disappointed!
author: Vee N.

description:
Tried the huevos con loroco at this wonderful little cafe. Very busy on the weekend with the locals.

Serving size is more than adequate for breakfast/brunch.

Great place to meet up with friends or for a small group.

The loroco which is a Salvadoran vegetable was tasty and the eggs cooked well. 

Service was attentive and very quick. 

Will be back for the pupusas next!
author: Carmen P.

description: Do not go to this place. I've been a loyal customer for many many years. My family and I got sick from an order we got to go as we usually we do. And I called the owner Jackie to tell her. She denied anything was wrong told us to never come back and EVEN dared me to write a bad review on yelp bc she said her business is that good nothing can hurt her!!! Unbelievable! I put a review up before and it was taken down so something fishy is going on. Food now taste as bad as poor as poor customer service. I'm a loyal customer and she's not a smart business woman bc it all catches up with you.
author: jen v.

description: Nice food. I'm from El Salvador and the flavors are authentic. I'm also vegetarian. Get the cheese with Loroco pupusa instead of spinach and cheese( loroco is a fragrant flower with a distinct taste) check the prices of the combination plates. Sometimes it is cheaper to order a la carte. If you want updated decor go to the Balompie in the mission.
author: Nils H.

description: I came here with a friend who's a regular. He recommended the revuelta pupusa and I also split a fried and steamed corn tamal. The pupusa was really tasty, I loved the pork and beans inside and the red sauce. I also greatly enjoyed the fried sweet corn tamal that complemented nicely with the cream. The steamed tamal however was pretty dry and disappointing. Overall a great meal, good service and fair price.
author: Chelsea T.

description:
Pros:
Not too busy and we're able to get seated right away despite going on a Friday night (granted, it was pretty cold). The atmosphere seemed modern but was treated like traditional pupusarias/family owned. There were a lot of types of pupusas to choose from, ranging from traditional pork bean and cheese to spinach pupusas. The salsa has a tasty kick but not spicy. 

Cons:
According to my boyfriend, the pupusas were on the higher end at $3-$3.50 each but he said the size makes up for it (though it's not as thick). He also had the Arroz casamiento (black bean rice) which was pretty good but wishes the black beans weren't as smushed. 

Would try again if I am in the area but wouldn't actively seek it out
author: Jessa May C.

description: My new favorite restaurant in SF :)! I try to at least have this place few times a month , I'm so obsessed with pupusas ! They are so yummmy and cheesy ! I really enjoyed the jalapeño and cheese and I loved the Salvadoran enchiladas! I'm eager to try more things out soon ! Come here early it's always jam packed !! Oh and ask for the condiments for the pupusas , the picked veggies are my favorite
author: Monica M.

description: Me no likey. Plaintain's good.pupusas dry. Too much masa.Lacking cheese. Lacking meat. Maybe Sundays is their off day. The good cooks went to church. Not that there's anything wrong with that.
author: john o.

description: Balompie's offered fantastic pupusa's in a very down-to-earth environment. The service was fine and pretty quick. If you're in the neighborhood and enjoy quick and tasty meals, this is a stop you should make!
author: Paul S.

description: Love this place! Main reason I love it is the specialty pupusas. They have a shrimp pupusa and a Mexican style pupusa with jalapeños! Faster and tastier than the other places I've been to. Not as slow either. Definitely recommend for all you pupusa lovers out there!
author: Christian N.

description: Pupusas were cheesy goodness. ordered and quick pick up available. I was upset that they didn't have a bottled sodas (bottle coke or jarritos) but it was still on their menu. other than that no complaints.
author: Fanny C.

description: Bests in town love this place great Papusas and enchiladas always packed great staff awesome food
author: Tanya H.

description:
Their Salvadoran food is good. The prices are reasonable. The staff is friendly and welcoming.  It is a casual place, there is a big tv, the noise level can get loud, it is kid friendly. 
They have authentic saldadorean dishes. There is street parking which can be a challenge.
author: Liz B.

description:
Fresh ingredients used in pupusas. Great size. Order your food in advance if you can. It takes at least 20 minutes to prepare the order so be ready to hang around a bit if you are ordering to go at the counter. 

NOTE: This spot has gotten busier now that The Santaneca (another Salvadorean Restaurant across the street) closed down over a month ago.
author: Cindy D.

description: I love this place when I'm craving pupusas.  Have try several restaurants that make pupusas, but this def is my favorite one. The pupusas are perfect in size, not greasy, and delicious. I have order other things here and everything is really good. I highly recommend this place if your looking to have some good El Salvadorian food!!
author: Regina C.

description:
Used to be my favorite. Not any more. 

We placed and order to pick up, they got the whole order wrong. I called and she said we'll have the correct order for you. When my friend went to pick it up, she said we won't give you the food till we returned the incorrect order. Since my friend was already there, she said I can show you pictures of the wrong order and she declined to see pictures and did not give her the food. 

When I called back, she said that's our rule. You have to bring back the food. How am I supposed to know that rule? She said she can't do anything about it since she's not a manager or owner. 
I asked to speak to them and she said they were not present. She was not apologetic for screwing up the order. 

I've attached pics of the order and the receipt. Everything was wrong ... all 4 items!!! 

No food & no refund. 

I will ask my friends and family not to go. And would recommend being wary of their customer service.
author: Wildeflower M.

description: Have had this restaurant bookmarked for a while and so happy to finally have had the chance to go here. It's not a huge restaurant and it's pretty popular. We arrived here on a Friday evening and luckily there was one table left. We ordered the sampler plate, 2 pupusa plate, and a side of platanos. Everything was so goood! We ended up eating only half of our plates and took the rest home. Staff is friendly and kind. They also do accept credit card, which is great. Definitely try a bit of everything. It's all delicious.
author: Julie L.

description:
I've recently been dreaming about visiting this place again. Oh yes I have. Twas here that I first tried PUPUSAS and fried yucca. Fried yucca reminded me of potato, but richer and denser. It sat like a rock in my tummy, but I don't care. I loved every bite of it. 

It's hard to describe what a pupusa is if you've never had one. Created by Salvadoran geniuses, It's a big ol fat, homemade corn tortilla stuffed with magic and rainbows, is what it is. Like if tacos came as calzones, with fresh maiz dough. Balompie has many delicious flavors to choose from, as well as sides, beers, and footie on the tele. This would be a swell place to hang out and watch the match.
author: Jenny P.

description: Pupusas, come get it! Something new, something delish. Salvadorian yumness, with homemade soul and masterfully authentic delishness!
author: Leslie L.

description:
Craving a really good pupusa and this place seemed to be the highest rated amongst all pupuserias in SF. When I first walked in here, I was thinking "man, this place is popppinn" bc it was a packed house. I'm happy I got seated quickly. 

Must try
- zucchini + cheese pupusa and the vegeteriana pupusa
- HORCHATA, yaaasss it was so good. Best I've ever had.
author: AJ C.

description:
The zucchini pupusas are amazing!!!
Want to know what isn't amazing here? Let's begin with the unfriendly service accompanied by the RBF, also the 45 minutes it takes to make two pupusas and this has already happened on three separate occasions. Then I had to wait an additional 15 minutes(on top of the 45 minutes) after calling it in because it still wasn't ready. Parking is difficult, and while that is not their problem, waiting an additional 15 minutes becomes an issue if you have to double park or park 5 blocks away just to pick up your food.
author: Victoria S.

description:
Greatest pupusas ever. As you're in the cafe waiting for your pupusas to be served to you i love how you can hear the loud slapping of the pupusas being made. 

You can taste how fresh these pupusas are and the quality of them. I am so glad that i live up the street from these folks.
author: Payal R.

description: Great food. Wish they had a bigger selection of soups. Did have a wait 15mins after placing phone order. Parking pretty bad but again it's sf.
author: Ana S.

description: I went today with my mother to have some delicious Pupusas. But I knew something was weird about these pupusas... there was no chicharron in the pupusa. There was less than a teas spoon. Balompie wants to charge $3.00 per pupusa but where is the filling??? Again where is the pork???? We come from on Napa to San Francisco to enjoy this, and it was very disappointing. Not happy with what they made today. Before they would put a lot of chicharron and cheese for the revuelta. Today was a cheese pupusa with a smear of chicharron. Disappointed I am. I suggest you open your pupusa (lol) and check the content to make sure they made it correctly. Don't be cheap...please make sure that the ladies making the pupusas are making them like they did before. You will keep your customers HAPPY!!!!
author: Cristina M.

description: Service is pretty shitty with the cashier in the front, a little pricey for the portions they give you but food tastes great.
author: Alyssa R.

description: I have never had a 1 star cappuccino before, but this is a defining beverage I have in my hand. To say this drink is bitter enough to blind you is an understatement.
author: Timmy B.

description: Best popusas ever! I've been all over salvadorean places for good popusas but here in Balonpie has been my number one come to. Also staff is wonderful ask for Sandra she's very polite and always on track of you need anything.
author: Marjorie C.

description: The food is actually good when you can get someone on the phone that speaks enough English to get your order right. Instead of adding everything to the order that contains a word you say and he recognizes... other than that, if you can avoid that, (two thumbs up),You're great!
author: Sodro K.

description: Eat the super veggie pupusas! Yum. The price has gone up after the remodel of this place, but the food is always so good. Also try the order that comes with huevos, comiendo, and tortillas and queso fresco (that's your typical salvadorean breakfast) and the pupusas de arroz con queso y frijoles.... those are my fav!
author: Walter P.

description:
Decent pupusas.
$3 and up. Expensive.

Customer service is not good.
We came here and waited 15 minutes before being acknowledged. Never again.

Very tiny location. Fits 25 people comfortably.
Always packed with large families.

If you like space and warm hospitality, look elsewhere.
author: Angela B.

description:
Hands down the best pupusas I have EVER had. Everything about my experience here was 5 star. We were fortunate enough to get a table right during the dinner rush and despite only having 1 or 2 people busing tables, we had amazing service! 

We ordered a variety of pupusas and all of them were amazing! The dough was nice and thick so all of the filling stayed in and they were not overly greasy as pupusas can oftenly be. The pupusas range in price from $3.00 to $3.50, given the size of these pupusas I think it is a reasonable price. 

I was eyeing everything that came out of the kitchen and already have a list of menu items I am excited to go back and try!
author: Kristina S.

description: So I ordered through Postmates.I figure I needed some chicken soup to aid in killing this cold of mine. I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of tender chicken that was in the container. There had to be at least a large breast quarter in there. Though there was bone (this just let's me know it real deal soup) there was still a ton of meat. I hadn't expected noodle along with the veggies but they to were tender and not overly soft. The amount of broth and veggies was perfect! It was accompanied by onion, cilantro and lemon to add yourself and two handmade tortillas. I will definitely order this again! Oh and the pupusas were also perfection! You cannot go wrong ordering here!
author: CATRINA H.

description:
Everything was delicious! Will definitely be coming back. Pupusas were awesome. 

Thank you for posting it on the Santaneca's review page. I would of never know about this place otherwise.
author: D G.

description:
I've been to La Santaneca and used to frequent Rinconcito, both within a block's radius and this is my favorite. 

Tonight my friend and I sat at the bar enjoying some pickled vegetables which I found out was called, "escabeche". Seriously, more like escaBAEche. That stuff was the bomb. 

Great service. As always there is a little bit of a wait, but I'd rather wait 30 minutes here than go to the other places.
author: Melina M.

description:
Somehow it took me almost a year to visit this place after moving to within a few blocks of it.  And an equal amount of time to figure out that "Balompie" is a misspelling of a Spanish word for "football."  Which this place does not serve.  It serves mostly pupusas which, for the uninitiated are something like a Salvadoran hot pocket.  They make tons of varieties, of which our favorites were first the shrimp and second the zucchini (which they call "veg").  We thought the Loroco was just OK and my buddy liked the pork-laden Revuelta.  None of us were particularly in love with the huevos rancheros.

I'd definitely come back.  It's something of a party if you go during a major soccer game, which they put up on their TVs.
author: Aaron M.

description: Cute, bright, high ceilings, friendly service, espresso machine for brunch-goers, futbol for the fans, pupusas made while you wait (or watch if you're at the bar) and, oh yeah, they're delicious.
author: Annie S.

description:
Easily my favorite papusas in the city! 

Food: 5/5
The papusas are delicious and are made right in front of you. My favorite was the chicken and cheese although the bean and cheese and Salvadoran vegetable was also great. 

Ambiance: 3/5
Nothing special, but you can sit at the counter and watch them make papusas. But - the ambiance isn't why you go out for $3 papusas!

Pricing: 5/5
Which reminds me, this place is super affordable. We had a feast for 3 people and only spent $30.
author: Paloma N.

description: Unbelievably horrible!! What happened????? I should have demanded my food be corrected but I have just lost my grandson age 3 and I didn't have it in me to continue! 1 tamal brought out tasted old! No apologies! Came back with some oily weird looking plátanos! Then sent that back and they came back fine! Ordered pupusas revueltas and chicharrón con queso ... to taste mostly cheese! When I told the "owner" I asked "have you changed cooks" your food seems really declined in taste. Oh no she replied I just have to tell him to add more "chicharrón" ... REALLY???!!! No apologies! Food sub par & the face of I don't care ... was a slap in the face. Didn't offer a single thing to rectify all the mistakes! Won't go back!!!!  Sad thing ... it was the owner!!!!!
author: Raquel O.

description: Sport Restaurant and Cafe...that'll it. Doess best small .place. Thanks...For understand them
author: Joseph M.

description:
My dad, a native Guanaco, has been trying pupuserias from the SF Mission area since the late 1960's, before Yelp!  In the late 1990's or early 2000 (still before Yelp), he discovered Balompie on 18th and Capp. It has been the favorite of my family since that time.  I once took a colleague from Japan to give him a taste of salvadorean food. 
Sadly, today we held my father's funeral. In honor of my dad, we contacted Balompie#3 to cater his funeral reception. We ordered 50 pupusas-revueltas, queso-frijol, queso-loroco, and queso espinaca.
One large order of casamiento
One small order platanos con crema 
One order yuca con chicharrón 
Our food arrived on time, nice and warm, and we all enjoyed the meal, and the food side of the funeral was stress free. 
Cost was very reasonable. 
Food was outstanding. 
I am forever indebted to Jackie and her staff for helping during a stressful time and upholding my fathers honor.
author: Oscar G.

description: I love the pupusas that I had I had rebueltas1,beans and cheese 1and only cheese they were good had rice beans in the side and my friend had 3 also one lorroco witch is like an herb or vine like described how my friend said lol and well it was good but service it's was pretty fast and lady could of been more cheerful lol othe4 then that I did not come n see ppl i came to eat bruhhh give me my comida lol aka pupusas in this case
author: Crymari G.

description: Nothing says SF like some good home style Salvi food. We have been coming to Balompie and it never disappoints. From Pupusas (a Salvadorian staple) to Sopa De pollo , pastelitos (empanadas) you name it they got it here fresh & made to order. Nothing more inviting than walking into a true Salvi establishment and hearing the sounds of the señoras hands smacking them pupusas lol the Resturant is clean, the staff is amazing and really makes you feel welcomed . Jackie the manager who is often there always greets you with kindness and never forgets a face! We come all the way from Placer county to eat here and that means a lot to us to feel so at home at a place so far from home. If you have never explored Salvi food don't feel intimidated , there really isn't  anything you will order that will disappoint ! Maybe start with some traditional Platanos Fritos con frijoles  (fried plantains and beans).
author: Michelle K.

description: Love this place. The papusas are great! I can't eat much here anymore due to a food restriction but literally send anyone who visits from out of town here! The papusas are great!! and so is the soup!
author: Mandi J.

description:
Papusas like you read about is what this place is about. They're cheap cheap cheap - $2-3 each - and come with plenty o' salsa and cabbage sides.

It's seat-yrself situation inside and the service is prompt. I'll definitely be coming back for more papusas!
author: Andrew C.

description:
Scrumdiddliumptious (I doubt this is a word but hey) 

It's like eating home made Central American food!!!

Pura vida
author: Betsy C.

description: This place never fails every time I go here I get really good food and coming from a guanaca that says a lot I love the pupusas they are so good and not so doughy
author: Ines F.

description:
Now I grew up in the city and been to many, many Salvadorian restaurants in the area. I know, especially with the hole in the wall kind of restaurants, some amenities may be lacking. However, coming here was a MAJOR disappointment. 

Service is slow and lacking. Get a cup of coffee? Don't expect to get any refills unless you ask. They got my drink order wrong. It was plain coffee and a soft drink. The food took forever! And when we got the order of pupusas revueltas (meat & cheese) they lacked flavor. I don't think it had any salt. We got no curtido refill....it was a tiny bowl for 5 pupusas. Service actually didn't come again until the check was due. 

Look, I can put up with bad or even lack of service if the food was good. But it wasn't at all. I suggest for anyone in a mood for pupusas, just cross the street and go to La Santaneca. It may be always packed, but much worth the wait.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
They take so long on postmates. Do not order take out here. My post mate waited over 40 minutes at this restaurant. Its unprofessional and bad service, pupusas do not take that long to cook. I'm Salvadoreño and i heard there pupusas were good but perhaps to somewhere else. 


Las cerotas que trabajan aqui me colgaron y me dieron paja que tenian un orden de 100.
author: Daniel A.

description: Delicious authentic pupusas. What else can you ask? Try the rest the dishes as well if you want to truly experience the Salvadorian cuisine
author: Rodolfo C.

description:
Parked across the street while on my way to my dentist appointment so I ordered some food to go for dinner. 

This place was totally packed for Wednesday 4pm and I've heard lots about it. I was actually headed to the other Salvadorian place next door but made a last minute decision to go here instead. I ordered four pupusas and a side of plantains for all of $20. This managed to last 3 meals! They are surprisingly filling especially with the pickled veggies which were the best I've ever had. Definitely asking for extra next time. 

The shrimp and cheese was my favorite although at first I thought they just gave me a plain cheese one because I couldn't find any shrimp. It's minced pretty fine into the cheese. Plantains was a huge portion for only $4.50. They make everything when you order it. Service is very nice and everything is packed efficiently! Love this place!
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Good enough for me to come back and give this place another try, but our pickup order was all kinds of off. 

The food was good, but I think only the pupusas were among the actual order. There was a cabbage salad and empanadas missing, and instead we got some plantains and some other dish that I couldn't identify. The pupusas were delicious, but really greasy. I wrapped mine in a napkin to hold and eat it (we didn't have plates) and it was soaked by the time I finished.

All of it was really good though, soooo it's hard for me to want to stay away. Maybe eating in is a better experience in meeting expectations.
author: Krista L.

description: It is absolutely delicious, they gave us so much food , I think I need a sofa to rest on!!!! The pupusas are so wonderful, don't take my word for it, you must try! Had the two pupusas with rice bean and pork, fantastic, also tried the#18 yum. Bring you appetite.
author: Steven E.

description: An incredibly frustrating experience ordering from them with DoorDash.  The DoorDash menu lists their orders of pupusas as coming with 2 each, for $6 an order.  $50 later, we received 5 pupusas.  The woman on the phone insisted that they only sell the pupusas one each, refusing to believe that the menu is listed differently online (it is -- check).  She was unhelpful and even insisted that we let Doordash know that HER business' menu is incorrect.  Regardless, our family did not have enough food for dinner and we way, way, way overpaid.
author: Victoria D.

description:
If you don't know what a Pupusa is, it's a traditional salvadorian dish made of corn tortilla stuffed with a combination of cheese, veggies, or meats. I had no idea what a pupusa was until my friend told me I had to try it from Balompie and PayPal was offering a deal so I had no excuse not to try it. 

I ordered the Super Vegeteriana since it was posted in a picture and Cherylynn said get this! And I got the chicharron and queso. They're made fresh to order so it does take some time for your pupusas to be made. But when you get them fresh and hot off the grill, it's amazing. The cheese is all gooey as you bite through the soft fluffy corn tortilla. I'm not a big fan of the pickled veggies but that salsa or sauce they give is delish!

I've always ordered it to go and it took about 15-20 mins for it to be ready. But you can call in your order to make less wait time. I would like to dine in sometime and they have beers on tap and tvs to compliment your meal and dining experience. 

Staff was friendly and helpful in trying to get our order completed asap. 

Parking can be a pain in the area as your only options are on mission st or in the residential areas. But it's not as bad as downtown.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Good food, good service. There is always a line but food is worth the wait.  Love the pupusas and my favorite is Beef Soup.
author: Roc A.

description: I am very very picky about my pupusas but there's something about this place that screams El Salvador! Definitely a great stop for authentic pupusas not too sure about the rest of the food but definitely 5 stars for the pupusas I usually get revueltas ( beans cheese pork ) with rice maza and loroco which is a salvadoreño herb
author: Joshua M.

description: Love this spot!! The pupusas are fresh and not oily at all!!! Good flavor just like grandma used to make!!!
author: Greg N.

description: This place is now the best place is the neighborhood. The papusas are amazing, stick with them and you're great. I had the breakfast which was good, but not great.
author: Nick R.

description: The server girl is a super b**ct! Go to La Santaneca 1/2 block down. Better prices, better food, EXCELLENT service!
author: Louisa T.

description: Came back on a recent trip to SF and this time, I wasn't as satisfied or impressed. Fiancé and I shared 4 pupusas- pork, pork and cheese, shrimp and cheese, and prosciutto and cheese. The latter two were from the speciality ones and were more expensive at $3.50 each but had less meat. For more money, I expect the same or more amount of meat. Honestly I think I would be better off getting a plain cheese one for $3. The pupusas are large but I don't know if they're worth $3. Maybe $2-2.50 would be more appropriate. Like last time, the pupusas take quite a while to come out because they are freshly made but of the 4 we ordered, 2 came out maybe 15 minutes later, after the rest of our table was almost done eating. Their other plates look good, too, but I still think most items can be about $1 cheaper.
author: Kathy L.

description:
If you google the word Cafe, it's defined as:  

ca·fe, kafā,k-/
Noun: cafe; plural noun: cafes; noun: café; plural noun: cafés

1.small restaurant selling light meals and drinks.

But Balompie is much more than a simple café, it's a fabulous pupuseria on Mission Street.  The restaurant is clean and fairly large for a pupuseria.  Service was friendly and fairly quick.  We ordered:

Revuelta pupusa: can't go wrong with the traditional pork and cheese combo. 

Steak and cheese pupusa: the cool thing at Balompie is they will pretty much make any type of meat including seafood pupusas you desire. The steak and cheese was tasty. 

 Along with that I ordered rice and refried beans which completed the meal.  So for a really good "pupuseria" or should I say a "El Salvadorian Cafe", Balompie is an excellent option.
author: Michael L.

description: Terrible customer service,Jackie short hair, was rude and not people person. We ordered on phone to pick up, but when we got there it had parking so we went in and ask for dine in. She just rudely says "you ordered to go, its to go cant eat in"..to make matters worst we waited for another 10 min for my order, so i ask if we can dine in since its still getting prepared. She was very adamant about us not eating there. Lady we just spent literally $55.00 and this is your response, "YOU LOST A VALUABLE CUSTOMER" I WISH THERE WAS BUTTON FOR NEGATIVE AND RUDE SERVICE...
author: mami m.

description:
Ahhhh I think I found THE place to get pupusas, I kind of didn't even want to write this review. But since my tita shared this place with me, then I shall do the same.

Balompia is a small cafe on the corner of Mission street. It seats about 25-30 people and all of their staff are amazing - always smiling and ready to serve. My mom and I came in on July 4th craving pupusas and we had an open afternoon so we went for it! We ordered four pupusas: cheese, pork/bean/cheese, and 2 carne asada and cheese. On top of this, from a photo on yelp, we also ordered the shrimp cocktail. To help all of this amazing food go down, we also ordered one horchata. Everything was DELICIOUS. My personal favorites was the cheese pupusa as well as the pork/bean/cheese. I could've done without the carne asade and cheese one, honestly. The shrimp cocktail was great, shrimp in every bite! The horchata was yummy as well. 

Our bill came out to about $30 for all of this food.

I definitely recommend Balompie Cafe for great food and great service to pair!
author: Kathleene E.

description: One of my favorite Salvadoran restaurants in SF. They have a great selection of pupusas and more authentic items on their menu. Everything reminds me of the food I would get down there. The rice is just like my grandmother used to make. The Salvadoran sampler is an excellent value and always  hits the spot.
author: Joshua P.

description: 3 1/2 stars really. The shrimp omelette was pretty enormous and standard. My co-diners liked the black bean and rice that come with the dish. The huevos rancheros was also standard. The pupusa with Salvadorian veggies and cheese was tasty with good amount of cheese and not much veggies. The pork pupusa without cheese was smoky. Everything was large size. We tried the plantain with custard, which was interesting, as the plantain was mushed up and made into the outer shell then filled with cream inside. It was super sweet. I would not recommend it. Overall it was a decent visit.
author: Thuy V.

description: I am sitting in the restaurant for several minutes, it was 9:420pm. Waitress says, if she can help us, we begin to order! Then, she says we are closed! Restaurant web site says it closed at 10pm, I tell her this. And she responds, kitchens close at 9:45. I was very disappointed at the service and response, there good is great! But they lost my business.
author: Herbert L.

description: We just waited 50 minutes!! (yes 50 we counted) for 3 pupusas and a side a beans and rice and they didn't even apologize or hook it up! The food however is greasy and delicious, but 50 mins come on now people!!!
author: Carmen R.

description:
Every time I hear the word "pupusas", it makes me giggle. It reminds me of two things: the potty and a furry furnace. Tsk tsk, I know; that's what 8 years of Catholic school will do to you.

I'm always weary of any ethnic restaurant listed on 7x7's list. I mean c'mon, they listed Best Chinese: Mission Chinese Food, Best Viet: Slanted Door, and Best Mexican: Tacolicious which pretty much shows their lack of credibility. 

Balompie's pupusas has consecutively been on 7x7's Big Eat List for years but I was afraid that it would be just another overrated place overran by hipsters. 

Walking into Balompie #3 (#1 location is in El Salvador, #2 is the Mission) and seeing all natives gave me a huge sigh of relief. You know it's legit when you're the only non-natives there right?

Balompie has an extensive menu with salads, soups, Salvadoran breakfast items, omelets and meat and seafood plates.  What they're known for are their pupusas (think a Salvadoran grilled cheese sammie). Unlike La Santaneca and El Zocolo that has a handful of varieties, Balompie has 18! The standard fillings are $2.50 each and the specialty fillings are $3.50 each (minimum order is 2). Two pupusas per a person is  sufficient. 

Balompie gets packed on the weekend so there was a 20 minute wait on the Sunday afternoon we went. The crowd died down after 2 pm so if you don't like waiting, you should come for a late lunch. 

We saw several neighboring tables order the yuca fritas so Mr. NSS followed suit and ordered the Yuca Frita y Pollo ($8.75): http://bit.ly/1iTm2Ay. We also ordered three specialty pupusas to share ($3.50 each): Super Vegetariana: Spinach, Mushroom & Cheese, Pescado y Queso: Fish & Cheese, Italiano y Queso: Prosciutto & Cheese: http://bit.ly/18kn9o2 that came with curtido (cabbage salad) and salsa roja. 

Yuca is a wonderful alternative to french fries as it's loaded with potassium and fiber. The fresh out-of-the-fryer yucca fritas were deliciously crunchy with a tender center. We also ordered a side of crema ($.75) which became a great dipping sauce for the yucca frita when mixed with a few shots of tapatio.

Now on to the reason why we came to Balompie, THE pupusas! I hate paying for overhyped and overpriced ethnic food. Sure, Balompie's pupusas are pricier than your typical $2 pupusa but these were top-notch (corn masa was very smooth) and were very filling. 

Cutting into the crisp corn masa, all the fillings just oozed out like lava: http://bit.ly/1e3qdrg. My favorite was the Super Vegetariana which was like picking off all the sinfully good toppings from a pizza. It wasn't too greasy or salty; just plain cheesy goodness. The Pescado y Queso was my second favorite as it was filled with flavorful flakes of fish. I know fish and cheese doesn't sound appetizing but this combo works. While the  Italiano y Queso sounded like a winning combo, the prosciutto made the pupusa incredibly salty; way too salty to finish. I would advise not ordering this unless you like hypertension. 

The tangy curtido helped cut through the richness. I wish the salsa roja had more of a kick but nothing that tapatio couldn't solve. 

A family owned restaurant, service was very warm and friendly. Food does take a while to come out (~20 minutes) because they also have takeout orders but it was worth the wait. It would be nice if they provided complimentary chips to nosh on while waiting for our food. 

Sit at the counter and watch the ladies make your pupusa to order or you can sit at one of their 10 two-top tables and watch some soccer playing on the flat screen TV. 

Finding metered street parking is easy but if you're patient, you can find non-metered parking after several circles. 

My only gripe is that Balompie closes at 10 pm unlike La Santaneca and El Zocolo that closes at 3 am on the weekends. So much for sloshed eats. Then again, nothing good happens after 2 am...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
It used to be my thing regularly going around with my hot mexican woman checking all the spots for the best pupusas and checking spots more then once soo we can be for sure.

This place became a regular for me. 

It takes the  right person and the right amount of love to make a greeat pupusa.

I love the foods presence and the way its served the brightness, the color , the texture, the smell as its coming to you .

It just makes me wanna strip it down right away an start chowing down getting me all riled up inside and my pheromones going but I maintain my cool.

The omelets are really good here too and I like how cool the drinks are here.
author: Luke S.

description:
Definitely my favorite place to get pupusas. I was first introduced to pupusas by my friend's mother who made us pupusas and absolutely fell in love with them! 

This restaurant is one of the three Balompié Cafes that are located in the city. I usually come here because it is only a 5 minute drive from my place and parking is readily available for this area as opposed to the other areas in the city. 

This is a great place to go to for an inexpensive lunch. Pupusas are only $2.50 each!! What a steal!! They are made to perfection with the right amount of stuffing and the cabbage and sauces are sooo good! They are very generous with the cabbages and sauces and you can always ask for more! My favorite pupusas are always the pork/cheese and spinach/cheese but honestly, you cannot go wrong with any of their pupusas! They are also very quick with their service and the staff is super friendly! Their plaintains are also soo yummy! It is made with just the right amount of glaze and the portion is large enough to share between two people! 

The restaurant is decently sized and is at the corner of the street so it is very easy to spot! Take out is very convenient as it can get quite busy on the weekends and during lunch time. There is also a juke box in the corner if you want to blast some music while enjoying the delicious food! 

Definitely recommend trying this restaurant as the food is very inexpensive but delicious! Just the type of restaurants I enjoy going to. A must try! :)
author: Wendy Z.

description: This place has been on my bookmarks for years and years. Then finally I got around to trying it. From the outside it doesn't look like a sit down place but from the inside it looks like a cafe! A very clean place. Decent-good service. We asked for more cabbage and red sauce quite frequently. My group ordered the horchata, shrimp/cheese, spinach/cheese, ground chicken/cheese, zucchini/cheese, ground pork/cheese, and steak/cheese pupusas. The horchata is a different type from the normal one, but still good! But it is really sweet. The pupusas were amazing !!! The fillings were on point and they were stingy with the fillings. Everything was full with flavor! My favorite was the steak/cheese and the shrimp/cheese. It does get somewhat busy here on a weekend.
author: Janet Z.

description: Excellent pupusas, the way they should be done everywhere. Environment is casual and inviting. A good place for soccer fans with a lot of soccer stuff hanging on the walls and a TV playing soccer matches. Staff needs to be a little friendlier.
author: Sergio J.

description:
The last time I had real authentic pupusas was back in September of 2012 - at the "El Salvadorean National Celebration" over at the San Mateo Expo with this awesome woman who made them off her food truck and lines kept going and going. I waited thirty minutes for mine.  So it was only fitting to find the best of the best pupusas, and since I was also having an interesting "car adventure day," being towed, having car repairs in the last 48hours, this was the place to be!

I invited my BFF who lives in Bernal Heights. I popped my trusted YELP and saw several reviews from my esteem YELPER friend "Loon E." - who by the way has outstanding reviews that will get you laughing so hard you will be peeing by the time your done.

After reading his reviews from different locations nearby, we decided with Balompie Cafe. I must say - amazing. Loon recommended we try LOROCO Y QUESO.  Oh my god - this was sooooo good.  It was literally melting in my mouth.  It had that fresh lite corn tortilla crunch taste to it with a soft fresh filling of cheese and veggie inside. It was not at all greasy.  Large portion too for only $2.50 each, they were very generous. And since we were already there, we decided to order more and try their Fish, Beans, Steak and Cheese pupusas too.  They were all delicious but I have to say the loroco y queso was the bomb! Insanely good!!!! Thank you Loon E. for this awesome recommendation. Oh and don't forget to order their fresh Horchada, the fresh grounded cinnamon was outstanding.

May I also suggest you try their shrimp soup which by the way was out of this world too.  It was not shrimp pasty at all. The broth tasted fresh and they gave us a large portion of prawns to boot!  It also came with two plain pupusas as compliments of the dish, diced onions, fresh parsley and slices of lemon. And for only $12.95, this would be good for one if you are very hungry, or for two to share. 

If you are in search for authentic, taste like homemade pupusas, I highly recommend coming to this very cute neighborhood corner gem in "The Mission."  It is hip, clean, service is excellent, and the food is simply delicious. So good in fact, I ordered extra Loroco Y Queso to go.

Cheers!
author: Edwin R.

description: I can't wait to go back the pupusas were amazing and the service was great. The wait on a Wednesday night was not bad at all. The horchata is something everyone HAS to try
author: Jocelyn L.

description: I was at this location yesterday for a pick up order, expensive and bad quality, pupusas revueltas were mostly beans, loroco and cheese we only found 2 lorocos, yuca w/chicharron tasteless and oily. Over $40 for 8 tasteless, bad quality pupusas and a terrible yuca con chicharron. Never will be back. Threw them away and ordered pizza.
author: Jose A.

description: Absolutely best pupusas in the Bay. My family and I love coming here after a day in San Francisco! Highly recommend their combo plate of a tamal, casamientos, a pupusa, and crema. The pupusas are a perfect size and not greasy at all (as some others can be). Absolutely love it!
author: Lucina P.

description: This is a hit and miss place especially with the servers.  Service with a smile maybe maybe not.  The pupusas are good, when they are busy you may get some not fully cooked.
author: Edgar B.

description: Being Salvadorian, I am very particular about my pupusas and any salvadorian dish. I've been coming here for years and every time I come back home I make it a point to come here with my mom. Something you must know, you have to get ready to look for parking. Might take you ten minutes to find a spot. When you get there, make sure it is with someone you want to be there with because you will wait for the food so make sure it's someone you want to have conversations with. Make sure you SPEAK UP! If you want something, i.e. water refill get the waiters attention and they will bring it to you. Don't automatically think they will come by. I know a lot of people are not used to that but because I've been here so many times I know the culture of the restaurant. Anyway, the food here is great and it is authentic. I usually get a salvadorian breakfast and some pupusas for later. Curtido is great and so is the salsa that goes with the pupusa. If you are from the city, I have no clue how you have not tried this place.
author: Ej L.

description: Food was OK, but the service was awful. No issues with being seated and promptly ordering, but we waited almost an hour from when we sat down to when our food arrived... And the place was only 1/2 full. While waiting we watched as people that weren't even in the restaurant yet when we ordered received their food. After we ate, I watched as the other tables promptly got their check, takeout, dessert orders, etc. while we sat there for another 20 minutes until I asked if we could have a check. I left a tip solely out of thanks to be leaving. If you're hungry, look elsewhere.
author: Mr. S.

description: Stumbled across this place on Yelp. It had hella reviews so we decided to try it! Who ordered Togo. It was a cute place, very crowded. I know why! ;) we ordered : shrimp & cheese , cheese , steak & cheese and last but not least , pork & cheese. A side of beans and a side of sour cream. It came with veggies and salsa on the side. All for $19! Awesome! We brought it home and devoured the whole thing leaving nothing behind! Everything was SO flavorful and amazing! If I must say ONE thing , the salsa could be spicier. But literally everything was great! I will SO be coming back! Thanks to my fellow yelpers!!!
author: Tia Marie M.

description: This is the worst experience I've had at this restaurant I waited a long time for them to take care of my order but then she was really rude then when I tried to order I tried to change my order but then they said they will not change my oriole and I have to cancel my order and then they would not serve me, that was the worst customer service all customer should be able to change their mind on their order i'm really unsatisfied they should be a lot more chain on being able to serve the customer they should have nicer people working there to be able to help the customer when they want to either change order or if they got the wrong order I was in a rush and I had to wait for my food but then I wanted to change my order and I ended up not getting served at all I will tell my Friends that I would not recommend a restaurant, never!
author: Sheila C.

description:
Order pupusas to go..they are sooo gooood
They are a little bit more expensive but they are really tasty and fresh.
author: p l.

description: Delicious pupusas! We got 5 different kinds and they were all so good. Food was fresh and didn't take too long after ordering, service was great!
author: Summer S.

description: I just moved in around the corner from this place, and this is definitely going to become a regular spot for me! Balompié has the best pupusas I have ever eaten, and I can't wait to try more of their menu!
author: Max V.

description: I would love to give this place 5 stars but unfortunately at this time can't. I have been coming here since they opened and I was hooked. The pupusas weren't greasy like other places they were fresh and cheesy (my fav) But lately I feel because this place has become well known the way they make the food has gone down hill. The pupusas are extremely greasy and I've been getting them burnt not exactly the taste I was going for especially when I have a craving for them. I really hope they slow down and make their food less greasy the way it use to be in the beginning.Or I will have to move on and sadly find another place. Quality over quantity.
author: Miss P.

description: Great pupusas! expansive menu, fast service.... the price is way too much tho - meal for 2 always ends up being $30+ whereas other pupusa spots its under $20
author: John O.

description:
Delicious stuff in a setting that you"d swear was in the middle of San Salvador,
Except it is too quiet. . .

     Had a revuelta and espinaca pupusas
Tamal sour crema. casamiento horchata.
Fantastic. The hot sauce the cabbage the crema salvadorania eas thick white cooling. i was stuffed. In San Francisco
Balompie:3 Monte Cristo and Saltaneca are my go to places for pupuseria and balompie#3 is now numero uno!#!
The most delightful lunch I've had in years!
Bien Sabroso!!
author: Bob R.

description:
My favorite Sunday ritual. Great food, great service, so consistent. The platanos are never undercooked and the pupusas are never too "dough heavy", lots of cheese and
fillings. They have anchor and Stella on tap and the atmosphere is low key and family friendly. Total neighborhood gem!
author: Laurel M.

description:
This is a friendly neighborhood joint -- there's always soccer on the TV, and the room (a former diner/cafe probably?) is decorated with football scarves. On weekends it's packed with families. I came on a weekday lunchtime and it was still bustling.

The pupusas are made from scratch when you order, so you may have to wait a little while to dive in and eat. Get fried plantains to keep your hunger at bay and enjoy some people watching while you wait. 

I get takeout as well because I don't live in the neighborhood anymore, but if I have time to sit down and dine in, I will do that because sitting on the 14 with a bag full of pupusas is too much to bear!
author: Vicky W.

description:
The 3 is a charm. This by far is the BEST Balompies EVAR. I am so glad my former boss brought me here. His gf is Salvadorena. She was the one who turned him on to this place because it was the only pupuseria she would wat out at, and now I see why! Their menu has the BEST selection of pupusa types NO ONE HAS, like PROSCIUTTO! I USED to like Los Panchos down the street. El Zocalo never impressed me.

Now, I have found my pupuseria. Not only is the food GREAT, it is also pleasantly decorated, simple and understated, without florescent walls screaming at me, or the cliche old world decor. It's hammered copper, clean taps, and I LOVE that I can watch the girls making my food, and they're not hidden in the back with the short wall between us. Everyone is pleasant.

The servers are efficient, even when you're drunk and bein a bit of a bitch... I will not eat pupusas anywhere else in The City ever AGAIN. They win my business everytime, and I am about to place a large order RIGHT NOW. May your doors remain open for years to come, and I wish you continued success! My only regret is that I never discovered you sooner, and that you're not open 24 hrs ;)
author: Stella T.

description: I ordered and when I got there the food was ready. I ordered the cheese pupusas and they're very tasty, real good. I like the restaurant but I do not like the fact that there is such a small area of tables and chairs you may have to wait a while to be seated. There is hardly any room to stand in the restaurant that you might have to wait outside. Bring a jacket.
author: Dorothy S.

description: Love, love, love this place. The pupusas are to die for, the service excellent and the atmosphere soccer centric. Did I say i love this joint?
author: Mike H.

description:
Still freakin delicious...no other place in the city can beat the pupusas here.  Pork, cheese, and jalapeño please!  

Yummmmmmmm!!!
author: Jen W.

description: Absolutely pleased with the service the gentleman provided us, my cup of coffee was never empty. I had the casamiento with huevos con chorizo, number 20th I think! Parking wasn't such a big deal but you have to pay. The place is small but cozy. I would recommend.
author: Joel P.

description: We came for Sunday lunch and had to wait about 25 to 30 minutes to be seated. Since it's such a tiny place we did have to wait a while - it was quite crowded. Once we finally got a table, we ordered right away. Then we had to wait another hour to finally get our food. And it wasn't really worth the wait. The food was good (I ordered the pan con pavo) but not anything worth waiting 1 hour for. Apparently their kitchen was understaffed. But for such a small restaurant I would think that the food such come out quicker. I don't think we will be returning just because of the ridiculously long time we waited for our food.
author: Priscilla A.

description: The food is delicious, however customer service is bad. Don't waste your time and go somewhere else. I'hv been going there due to the renovations in balompie on Capp street with my daughter. This one waitres has a beef with me and won't get over it because I didn't listened a while back when she told me to move to another table. So, I decided to go and oversee that hoping I will get better service from her or the rest of the crew. The owner standing by the register sees me sitting waiting for service with my daughter...walk by and nothing. It seems like they don't need my new business, nor people to refer them to. They got their wish and look forward to balompie at Capp and 18th
author: Carolina M.

description:
This place is always a winner. 

Pupusas:
They have some of the best I've ever had. Gooey, Flavorful, Piping Hot and cooked on the grill PERFECTLY and evenly.  

We had the very traditional Pork & Cheese Pupusa and the less traditional but VERY light and fresh Shrimp and Cheese (which I highly recommend!)

Curtido, is the insanely addicting cabbage vinegar slaw that is traditionally served with pupusa's and is my favorite part of the meal and Balompie Cafe 3 did NOT disappoint. With the right amount of vinegar and chile flakes it makes an amazing compliment to an already divine pupusa.

The place is clean, organized and the staff are polite. 

They even went way above and beyond for us to make something that wasn't even on their menu. Really awesome of them!
author: Meghan L.

description: Food and  service is good, four stars out of five,  their takeout needs time management improvements....  Dont say one time and you always running behind by 20+ minutes,  the last thing takeout patrons want to do is look dumb by the register for you to finish the order.
author: Daniel A.

description: I walked in and ordered several pupusas to go. The small cafe wasn't crowded on a weekday evening and it would have been nice have a sit down meal if I had the time. I saw beer on tap and heard the slaps of fresh pupusas being made. Service was friendly and our hot pupusas were nicely packed along with plenty of curtido and salsa. I devoured my pork and cheese pupusas ($2.50 each) in minutes. Even just a cheese pupusa would have been good so the pork added extra flavor. I'll be back to try some of the their specialty flavors but I have to say, even the breakfast menu looks good so I may return for that.
author: Maya S.

description: This is my first time I have eaten here but the service was great, staff are kind and seems to be very popular.  The food is excellent. Very tasteful and the selection is very wide. Thank you for making my lunch a super pleasant and filling..... muy pero muy rica la comida aquí.
author: Patty S.

description:
It's been at least two years since my last update and I'm still praising Balompie. I love coming here for brunch! I notice business has kicked up a bit, service is still great. This is soccer central, so you guarantee there will always be a game on. 

I always order the same things, so there isn't much there to update except my new favorite pupusa is the Mejicana Y Queso with ground pork, jalapenos & cheese. The old standbys include the Chicken and Cheese, the Super Vegetariano  and Italiana Y Queso with prosciutto & cheese. 

I come here for breakfast in the afternoon, usually order my coffee, water, a fat tire or blue moon and chips and salsa. You should order the picked vegetables (free), try the Casimento and the plantains with refried beans, crema and cheese are perfect to share. 

Also if you want to try a little something different, try the Salvadorean Sampler. It typically comes with yuca, a pastel, grilled meat. A little of everything. 

Perfect thing about this place is to order a couple dishes and your own pupusa then share everything. Life is about variety and you never know what you will like until you try it.
author: Rebekah T.

description: The taste good but my whole family just got food poisoning from there.  We each had a chicharon pupusa and my husband started feeling sick from his stomach, an hour later I was in the bathroom for hours, then my mother started vomiting. Old meat?
author: Luci F.

description: Good local spot for pupusas! It does get packed quickly so expect a wait for a table.
author: Celina G.

description: Happy customer every visit! Bests pupusas I've found in SF. Always consistently delicious, the service can be hit or miss, but I'm patient for good things. Highly recommend
author: Clarice W.

description: Honestly, this place is horrible. If I could I give it a 0 I would. Not worthy of a star. The owner of the restaurant is tacky and rude. I went in with my 9 year old brother and my mother to pick up our order that we placed over the phone. When we arrived we weren't even greeted and when my little brother asked us if we could eat there because he was starving we were denied. I asked the owner if we could dine in instead, seeing as how there were THREE tables available and also TWO outside. She then proceeded to tell us no and also used an example "how would you feel if you were a customer that was waiting to be seated and I gave up the table to someone that placed an order over the phone".... here's the thing, there was NO wait. And when my brother asked if we could eat outside she practically screamed at us saying "no". Also, my mom is diabetic and she needed to eat to take her medicine. The owner is just a mean individual and I don't understand how she runs the business. What kind of service is that? To paying customers. Needless to say we will never be paying this restaurant for pupusas! Horrible service! We definitely decided to not pay and left.
author: Bridgette G.

description: Absolutely love this place. Love the style, love the people. Their pupusas are SO good. Other types of food I have only ordered once and was not particularly impressed, but it wasn't bad either. Go for the pupusas.
author: Julia M.

description: I have been going here for a really long time. I grew up going to their other location on Capp. The food at both locations is extremely delicious!!! I love their breakfast!! I get it at any time of the day. They make their breakfast just like my mom used to on the weekend. I get the #20 with huevos con loroco. So delicious. All of their food is delightful, pupusas, platanos con crema. Yummmmm!!! and their tamarindo is on hit!!!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I love this place.
Very authentic and good service!
Pupusas are fresh and yummy! Def recommend
author: Leilani R.

description: Very rude. They made my order wrong put cheese on it, I couldn't eat it because I'm allergic. I  called back that night to ask if they are would remake my order for me. They didn't believe me. Won't remake my food or give me back my money asked if I could bring back the food that I let someone else eat for proof. They're food isn't great anyway. They're better places to get pupusas around there. Much love! Know before you buy!
author: Luis R.

description: Not very tasty pupusas also rather expensive. That being said they could have had an off day. I believe there is a legit chance they could be much better.
author: David L.

description: yummmmmmy!  This place is so good. A must try experience!
author: Jess J.

description: Balompie is a sports pupuseria. There's always rugby or soccer on, and lots of Salvadorans. Although I miss the one in my neighborhood, this one is even better. It's smaller and has faster service in a light, airy venue. As always, order a pacaya (palm blossom) for the table. You won't regret it.
author: Seth G.

description:
One of my favorites places for Salvadorian food. Love their ' pupusas de pescado " the best I have tried in CA . People are friendly , Place is clean,  price is fair... I have to mention " coffee "all the refill you want.  I ordered my Thanksgiving Turkey today  just for $90.00. 18-20 pound oven roasted turkey, salsa, and curtido enough for everyone... Thanks to the sweet lady in the kitchen ( I'm sorry I didn't ask her name ) because they weren't taking turkey's orders anymore and beside that they make a room for me. 
Totally recommend this humble and nice place every time you want to get good latin food to a fair price. 
Give them a try you wont regret .!!!
author: Morena M.

description: Food and service to the max! Awesome food the only missing star was the desert, seems they don't serve any famous Salvadoran deserts
author: Daniel T.

description: One of my favorite spots to get some freshly made pupusas! Fresh, non-greasy, tasty. Two should full you up! The service here is pretty good, and the wait time is fast. Love the chicken sandwich they have with fries, and the beers on tap! Check it out!
author: J M.

description:
Balompie on Mission is amazing! 

I wish they had seating for more people but the cozier the better.  Pupusas are always delicious and the staff members are consistently friendly and attentive. Bathroom is always clean, although their is a unique process for getting into the bathroom.

All good and authentic Salvadorian food, nice hot chocolate, okay coffee but limited alcoholic beverages.
author: Lisa T.

description: The staff was so nice and helpful! Pupusas were larger than I remembered they usually come, and it was a nice sight to walk in and see people making them by hand behind the counter. Platanos were also delicious. I might skip the tamales on my next visit, just because I've had better/preferred the pupusas. I did see everyone getting soup, so maybe that's worth a try next time.
author: Carolyn I.

description: This restaurant is on our normal roster for pupusas.  I particularly like the ones with rice flour. In addition to the prerequisite pupusas, the beef soup, chili relleno, chicken with prawns are also recommended dishes. Look around for what others are having for inspiration. Small place so I would limit party size to 4.  If larger group, be prepared to split up.  They do a pretty hefty ToGo business as well.  Parking is a bit of a challenge.
author: Maggie M.

description: I've been here a few times with my husband because we were either craving pupusas or in dire need of their shrimp or chicken soup because we had too much fun the night before (the latter only happened once a long time ago, I swear).  It's always pretty busy, but the service is quick and they have so many different pupusa options. I have no complaints about this place and always look forward to coming here.
author: Steph L.

description: Best popusas in all san francisco we come here from gilroy at least 4  times a year it is very worth it
author: Gio S.

description: Great place for a quick authentic lunch when you want to try something different. The food is good and people are nice.
author: Julia G.

description: Yummy pupusas. I recommend the cheese and loroco and revueltas. If you want something sweet, try their empanadas and platanos fritos. Friendly staff and fast service. I'm Salvadoran and wish there was something close to this restaurant in San Diego!
author: Sara A.

description: OMG OMG OMG....This place is BOMB! My friend brought me here and I was so impressed from the food I wrote this review...and posted pics all over my fb and am adding one here too..lol. The service was great, good hot chocolate, España was kicking ass in the background on their tv and the whole place was just awesome. The perfect place with the best food. I will have to come back for something other than breakfast, but that sold me for sure.
author: Bella B.

description: Papusas are awesome !!!!!!! Hella cheesy and not so greasy. Also I've gotten caldo de res here and it was pretty good. I usually order before time so I have never ate there but I'm pretty sure the service is good, because there food is bomb!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Celina G.

description:
5 Stars for their food and 2 Stars for a 50-min wait for lunch equals 3.5 over stars rounded up to 4 Stars.

Everyone has heard of and talked about Balompie, so there's no arguing their food is delicious. Our pupusas, once arrived, was oozing with cheese and the tortilla was of the perfect consistency and texture. So. Good.

We also ordered 2 enchiladas which came in an unexpected form. I suppose Salvadorian enchiladas aren't wet, but instead sat on a crunchy crust kind of like a tostada? In any case, the chicken enchiladas were excellent! Also excellent was the Ox Tail Stew plate with rice, bleans. The ox tail was tender and flavorful and swam in the most melodic tomato-y sauce. Perfect to eat with the rice and beans. 

But I don't know if this is okay, but I don't think a 50 minute wait on a late Saturday lunch (12:30pm ish when we got there) is justifiable for ANY restaurant. There were many cooks, cleaners, hosts.. all walking back and forth looking occupied, but not super busy. We grew hungrier and hungrier.... to a point it was starting to be irritating. So be forewarned about potentially waiting eons for your orgasmic food.
author: Jing D.

description:
Pupuserias are plentiful on Mission, so much so that it's hard to tell a good one from a bad one. Trust me, this is a good one, and it  happens to be on the residential stretch before the 280 interchange if you're heading south. Variety is Balompie's trump card because as good as El Zocalo's is down the street, they really only offer cheese, pork and loroco. That's it. At Balompie, there's also shrimp, beef, sausage, mushrooms, vegetables, and jalapenos. It's almost like a pizza menu.

Jamie W. and I were in a peckish mood last weekend when we remembered seeing this Balompie outlet on the way back to the car from Giovanni's down the same block. It's a smallish space but fortunately not too crowded on a Sunday evening. Jamie went for the Mexicana Y Queso (ground pork, jalapeno and cheese), while I ordered the simpler zucchini and cheese (see photo). Both were $3.50, and you get two each. Although El Zocalo still holds the prize for texture, the pupusas here are satisfying, especially with the curtido and hot sauce. Definitely worth a return trip.

FOOD - 4 stars...the Baskin-Robbins of pupuserias...if they don't make 'em, they don't exist
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...nice enough space
SERVICE - 4 stars...very friendly and helpful
TOTAL - 4 stars...A Pupusa-palooza!
author: Ed U.

description: This is my favorite place in SF for pupusas. I am partial to the shrimp and cheese, but they are all excellent. You can see them making the fresh right behind the counter. The service here is very friendly and the food comes out fast. And you can't beat the prices!
author: Diana G.

description:
After taking my PIC for a motorcycle tour around the city, including Ocean Beach, China Beach, Sea Cliff, Presidio, Lombard Street, Coit Tower, Alamo Square and Twin Peaks, we decided to top off the gorgeous day with some pupusas and Blue Moons.  

Ever since I first brought her here, she's been hooked and agrees that they dish up the best pupusas, this side of the Copinula.

Additionally, we were again impressed by the attentive service.  Some wait staff will ask if you want more hot water for your tea when they see your glass is almost empty, but others just bring it to you.  Nice touch.

Gonna be sorry to miss the group dinner on January 10th.  I'm sure all will agree that this place smokes La Santaneca, which was the other choice being slapped around, like a pupusa in the hands of an expert.  

Let's see.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Food: 4/5
Price: $$
Portion: 4/5
Appearance: 4/5
Presentation of food: 3.5/5
OVERALL: 4/5

Came here last night with the hubs and a girlfriend of ours, I never legitimately had authentic Pupusas. So it was to my pleasant surprise I enjoyed it (even though I am Lactose in Tolerant). 

Chicken + Cheese
Pork + Cheese

So the chicken and cheese was pretty good, I am a huge fan of Poultry in general. So it was to my shock that I enjoyed the Pork and cheese a little more than the chicken. The pork just seemed to have a little more flavor than the Chicken. Besides the fact that the pork was on the saltier side, it was great. Moist, shredded pork, and cheese thats SO Ooey Gooey I don't have much to complain.

You must order in sets of 2 Pupusas. That's their requirement, but to be honest I think 2 is the perfect sized meal. Definitely will come back if I ever crave for some Pupusas!
author: Eva H.

description:
At first I was skeptical about going in. I grew up with my grandmas homemade pupusas and homemade horchata and it is very hard to find a place that makes them almost as good as hers. 

I came here with my sister one day and I must admit, we left very happy. They serve big portions for a great price. The pupusas are big and very tasty. Nice environment. Parking is not that great but the food makes up for it. 

If you are near the area, I would reccomend to give it a try. They take phone orders as well.
author: Rosa H.

description: Best pupusas Ive had! Love their breakfast, chorizo with refried beans, rice and Salvadoran made tortillas. That will FILL you up for the rest of the day lol! Their fried plantanes are to die for! Enjoy!!!
author: Carlos C.

description: Daughter and I enjoyed best pupusa's ever. Loved hearing the pat pat pat of the women forming & cooking them on the visible griddle. I had sampler plate. The fried yucca was also best I have had! Will definitely eat here again!
author: Robin C.

description:
Outstanding pupusas

The service is great. The inside is always super clean. I love to make this place much more cozy by playing some good salsa music on their internet jukebox. You can here the ladies smacking together the pupusa dough in their hands making them as fresh as possible. The pickled cabbage aka cortido (core-tee-tho) is just spicy enough but not too spicy compliments the gooey/cheesy pupusa so well.
They take cards and cash. Its a win/win if you've always loved pupusas your whole life or if you've never hand them before.
author: Andrew Z.

description: Just like their other location in the mission, service is really slow. Expect to wait almost 20mins for an order of papusas. Papusas is great tho! Many filling options and made to order. We had ordered 2 each to go and we were stuffed. Papusas are cheap too starting at $2.50. Combine that with their coleslaw and red sauce, it's fantastic! Come here for yummy papusas but be prepared to wait. Restaurant can fill up fast too, there's a reason why.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description: Hole in the wall shop in Bernal with surprisingly delicious pupusas.  2 pupusas are more than enough to fill you up for dinner.  The rice and beans that come with the combination plate are negligble at best, but delicious nonetheless.
author: Patricia K.

description: I've been to numerous salvadorean restaurants and tried numerous pupusas. These pupusas at Balompié #3 are the best I've ever tasted. I am salvadorean and I've had homemade pupusas that are beyond delicious. Sorry grandma, but these at Balompié exceed anything I've had. I encourage people to come have their first or 100th pupusas here because it is worth it. Parking can be a struggle and it is a bit small, but trust me you'll forget about all that once your pupusa is in your mouth. ¡Buen Provecho!
author: Tori R.

description:
My love for pupusas goes beyond my love for any other food and I swear this place makes me want to shed tears of joy! I was literally chewing with my eyes closed to savor all the delicious flavor. 

Ordered 1 Cheese, 1 Revuelta, 1 Mexicana y queso and 1 carne asade y queso, Horchata and the plantain empanada with custard. 

Yes, I ate them all and yes I didn't share. I may sound like a greed and a glutton but if you were to taste the heavenly goodness of their pupusas you wouldn't share also! I will definitely come back!!
author: Angelica G.

description: Great food .. Horrible service. I come here all the time and I usually try giving them the benefit of the doubt because of there yummy pupusas. However today was the day I decided to write this review. The waitress didn't acknowledge us, the food order was wrong, and not once were we asked if we needed anything else. They took way too long for our food to be brought . Not the first time it happens . If you do come I suggest you order in advance. Ridiculous
author: Dina H.

description:
Balompie has a rep for one of the better pupusa places in SF. I'm Salvadorian so I've had my fair share of pupusas in LA, El Salvador and SF. What really separates Balompie from other pupusa places is their devotion to soccer / futbol. Go during lunch and you will see games on the TV from all over the world. 

Pupusas are good. Tamales. Platanos. They have a solid traditional menu. This location is much nicer than the original though a bit further out than the center of the Mission.

This is a great pupusa place and I look forward to going back.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Pros:
- pork, jalepeno, and cheese papusa was my favorite.
- fried banana empanada with custard was pretty good. 

Cons:
- prosciutto papusa was good but it started to taste too salty for my liking after the first two bites. 
- the sauce for the papusa was too runny/watery for my liking.
author: Wendy T.

description: I absolutely love their pupusas , as salvadorian I know about pupusas and this place is so far the place I know where I can go and enjoy a delicious pupusas. Other food is ok not the best but is decent.
author: Rosmery G.

description: The food was good, let's get that right. But... the service was bad, fist we waited longer than they said, once inside we order our food but they brought wrong orders for a couple of us. We ask for more Curtido and they never brought it. They never checked on us. Food was good just need better service!
author: Tomas M.

description: Best pupusas in the city now!! Only moms home cooked can beat them. Great bfast spot!!
author: Big M.

description:
My friend Rebekah knows papusas. So when she makes it a point to recommend a little place located on the quiet side of Mission Street you must heed her words of wisdom and make your way there.

Balompie 3 is an absolute gem of a restaurant. The minute you walk in you are greeted by the super friendly staff. The restaurant is clean and decorated with futbol memorabilia on the walls and two large flat panel televisions on either mounted high on the walls where you can catch a glimpse of the River Plate and Boca Junior game in high definition. 

The dining room is small, yet spacious and open. The kitchen is clearly visible from most of the tables where you can spot your breakfast order being freshly and prepared by experts in El Salvadoran cuisine. The menu is authentic and all your favorites are included. On this Saturday morning, three of sat down to feast on as much as we could and sampled each others choices. My wife went with the huevos con chorizo, this dish is served with refried beans and rice. The eggs were perfect and not overcooked. The flavors of all the ingredients were shining and my wife throughly enjoyed her meal. I went with the Number 19, plantains with crema and refried beans. This dish is served with a little cube of goat cheese which I am telling you right now, do not overlook this tiny little box of cheese goodness. Sprinkle a little on your beans as the saltiness of the cheese combined with the richness of the beans are a match made in Heaven. I also got an extra side of eggs over medium which helped round out the dish. 

My wife and split an order of papusas, one bean and cheese and pork and cheese. Both were delicious, but surprisingly we agreed that we preferred the bean and cheese. A word of warning, these things are filling and even after 5 hours am still completely stuffed and cannot ever imagine eating again.

A nice selection of salsa, cabbage and pickled jalepenos and carrots accompanied our food along with a side of thick hand made corn tortillas. I also made certain that a bottle of Tapatio sauce was brought over which I then used to sprinkle on my beans. 

The service is excellent and the waitstaff made sure that our coffee cups were always warm and water glasses always filled to the rim. I cannot wait to make a return visit.
author: Rene C.
